ach time a special or wild destiny card is drawn, remove the planet with the most ships on it from the game (offense breaks ties), sending all ships on it to the warp. If a player's home system is reduced below three planets, all players lose the game.

ll of the players in the game have three minutes to make a deal. All players must accept the deal or it fails. If the deal fails, all players lose 3 ships to the warp.
If the ships survive the encounter, they do not return to the warp.

During this encounter, if both main players reveal attack cards, add together the totals of both sides. If the combined total is over 25, a deadly meteor storm is triggered by the fighting, causing both sides to lose, regardless of other game effects.
Immediately flip over both the discard pile and the deck. The deck becomes the new discard pile and vice versa. Afterwards, shuffle the new deck.

During this encounter, if one main player reveals an odd-numbered attack card and the other reveals an even-numbered attack card, the player who revealed the odd-numbered attack card automatically wins the encounter.

11.name: Odd Way to Win a War

body.value: For the duration of this encounter
After the defense has been determined
, the two main players trade powers. This includes everything that goes with a power, such as the Miser's hoard,
Industrialist's stack, etc. After the end of the encounter,
powers traded due to this hazard are given
Defensive allies receive a colony if their side wins this encounter, while offensive allies receive
rewards if their side wins this encounter.
During this encounter, any cards played (including encounter cards, flares, artifacts, etc.) are removed from the game after taking effect.
(i.e., if play was passing clockwise, it now proceeds counterclockwise)
While The Witness is in play,
layers do not lose their alien powers because
too few home colonies. Any player who has lost
alien power in this manner gets it back while The Witness remains in play.
Discard The Entropy Beast and The Cosmic Guardian when The Witness enters play.
If you have fewer than eight cards in your hand, choose and draw cards from the discard pile until you have eight cards, if possible. The encounter immediately ends successfully.
If you have fewer than eight cards in your hand, you may draw a random card from the discard pile.
Free all of your ships from the warp and place them on your home colonies. The encounter immediately ends successfully.
Free one of your ships from the warp and place it on one of your home colonies.
Gain two rewards for each planet you occupy with another player. The encounter immediately ends successfully.
If you occupy at least one planet with the offense, gain two rewards.
You may discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw cards until you have eight cards in hand. The encounter immediately ends successfully.
If you have fewer than eight cards in hand, you may draw one card.
For each ship you have on a foreign colony, draw one card. The encounter immediately ends successfully.
If you occupy a planet with the offense, draw one card.

Draw a random unused alien sheet and place it faceup in front of you. If it has Game Setup text or is not allowed in this game, discard it and draw again. You have this alien's power in addition to your own. The encounter immediately ends successfully.
Draw two flares from the unused flare deck.
Each player that sends ships into this encounter can only send ships from one planet in their home system. If the offense has no ships on home planets, the offense immediately loses the encounter.
Each ally that sends ships into this encounter can only send ships from their foreign colonies. Players that have no foreign colonies cannot become allies.

The offense gives one card of their choice from their hand to each player whose system they have a colony in. If the offense would not have enough cards to do this, they send one of their ships from each of their foreign colonies to the warp instead.

Add the Reward Deck variant (ðŸ•®10). If it was already being used, add the Ultra Reward Deck sub-variant. If the Ultra Reward Deck sub-variant was already being used, starting with the offense and proceeding clockwise, each player draws one card from the reward deck.

Then, if there are at least three cards in the hazard deck, suffle this card into it.

defense looks at the top six cards of the deck and sets them aside facedown. If the defense wins, they may draw any number of the cards, give any number to their allies, and discard the rest. If the offense wins, they may look at the set-aside cards, draw any number of them, and discard the rest. Otherwise, discard the set-aside cards.

During the planning phase, each main player cannot select a negotiate card if they could select an attack card. If one main player reveals a negotiate card and the other reveals an attack card, no compensation is collected.
If a main player loses this encounter, the player to their left must send a number of their ships to the warp from any of their colonies equal to the number of ships
main player had lost in the encounter.

During this encounter, this card may be offered as part of a deal. Otherwise, at the end of the encounter, it is added to the winner's hand (after compensation, if any). While this card is in a player's hand, it has the following ability:

After you reveal an attack card, you may reveal this card to treat the attack card at an attack 15 or, if you discard this card, an attack 30.

At the end of this encounter, for each revealed attack card or played reinforcement card, its owner must discard one card from their hand at random, if able. Then, each player who revealed a negotiate card
one reward, and each non-main player who is not an ally
The offense discards their hand (this effect does not end the encounter). Each other player gives a card of their choice from their hand. Then, each player draws one card from the deck.
If a main player wins this encounter, they draw a tech card (even if the technology variant [ðŸ•®9] is not being used). If there is a successful deal, each main player draws a tech card.

After determining the winner of the encounter, add both encounter total together. If the sum is at least 42, the planet explodes and is removed from the game. All ships in the encounter are sent to the warp.
If the offense wins this encounter, they may release all of their ships from the warp. If the defense wins, all players except the offense may free all of their ships from the warp.

For each ship the offense has in the encounter: if the offense wins they draw one card from the deck; if they lose they give the defense one card from their hand at random; or if they attempt to make a deal, the players have an additional 30 seconds.

Add the Extremely Hazardous sub-variant (ðŸ•®11).

When this card is discarded, remove that sub-variant.

Add the Procedural Change sub-variant (ðŸ•®11).

When this card is discarded, remove that sub-variant.
After revealing encounter cards, if only one main player reveals an attack card, their side immediately loses the encounter, regardless of other game effects.

After a deal has been made that includes establishing a colony, each player in that deal may discard a negotiate card from their hand to cancel one colony that would be established. If this results in no colonies being established
nothing else happening in the deal, the deal is unsuccessful
The value of each played reinforcement card is doubled.

If there are only three players in the game, discard this card (without discarding a previous semi-permament hazard, if any). Then, draw another hazard card.

Main players cannot invite more than one player to ally.
